body:
```
@NotNull method io/flutter/run/FlutterAppState.startProcess must not return null
java.lang.IllegalStateException: @NotNull method io/flutter/run/FlutterAppState.startProcess must not return null
    at io.flutter.run.FlutterAppState.startProcess(FlutterAppState.java:92)
    at com.intellij.execution.configurations.CommandLineState.execute(CommandLineState.java:80)
    at com.jetbrains.lang.dart.ide.runner.DartRunner.doExecuteDartDebug(DartRunner.java:125)
    at com.jetbrains.lang.dart.ide.runner.DartRunner.doExecute(DartRunner.java:84)
    at io.flutter.run.FlutterRunner.doExecute(FlutterRunner.java:77)
    at com.intellij.execution.runners.GenericProgramRunner$1.execute(GenericProgramRunner.java:43)
```

To repro (this scenario is not a common one for users):
- open an existing flutter project
- install the flutter plugin
- restart
- set the path to the flutter sdk
- devices now show up in the device pulldown
- hit debug; see exception

comment_data.body: cc @stevemessick -- I'm curious if this is still valid?
Someone other than me will need to test it. I suspect it is fixed, though.

üëç  Thanks Steve!

Optimistically closing.  @devoncarew : feel free to re-open if it persists.

title: NPE on app debug
